name: Plank Shoulder Taps
how_to_perform:
1. Begin in a high plank position with your hands placed shoulder-width apart on the floor and your feet about hip-width apart. Ensure your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels. 
2. Engage your core by pulling your navel towards your spine and squeeze your glutes to keep your hips stable.
3. While keeping your body as steady as possible, lift your right hand off the ground and gently tap your left shoulder.
4. Return your right hand to the ground and immediately lift your left hand to tap your right shoulder.
5. Continue alternating shoulder taps in a controlled manner for the desired number of repetitions or duration, ensuring your hips remain square to the floor throughout the exercise.
short_summary: The Plank Shoulder Tap is a core stability exercise where you maintain a plank position while tapping your opposite shoulder with each hand, alternating sides.
